intro: Leobordea persica, commonly known as Persian leobordea, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
